p: Type A and B influenza viruses have caused significant morbidity, mortality and economic burden worldwide [ 1, 2]. Influenza virus has an annual cycle, with a peak occurring in winter in temperate regions [ 3, 4]. However, seasonal activity of influenza virus in the tropics/subtropics has not been well characterised. The annual or semi-annual cycles, year-round activity, as well as periodicity transitions have been identified [ 4, 5].
